We are pioneering a comprehensive platform for neural and biosignal processing and multi-modal analytics. Our platform, products, and automated workflows are used by leading companies and research institutions around the world to accelerate scientific R&D in areas such cognitive state decoding, neural biomarker discovery, exploratory analysis, hypothesis testing, scientific validation, and statistical and machine-learning analyses, real-time cognitive measures, etc. Our real-time data processing and BCI technology stack empowers developers to create transformative brain- and body-aware applications impacting health and wellness, human performance, learning, experiential technology, and more. Excellent communication skills, ability to self-manage projects, and motivated team player.    A desire to thrive and grow in a fast-paced and challenging high-tech startup environment working on advanced research projects.    Professional conduct respecting HIPAA and other applicable regulations, as well as confidentiality requirements of Intheon’s customers and partners.    Commitment to maintaining an open, welcoming, harassment-free, and equal-opportunity workplace. Track record of peer-reviewed scientific publications.    Familiarity with current-generation neural data analysis techniques, particularly related to electrophysiology (e.g., spectral analysis, source estimation / localization, functional / effective connectivity, multi-subject analysis, artifact removal). Experience with other neural and non-neural modalities is a plus.    Solid programming skills (clean, well-documented and well-tested code).    Prior experience working with Python data science tools (e.g., numpy, scipy, pandas, matplotlib, jupyter, statsmodels, etc.).    Demonstrated solid understanding of, and prior experience working with, various general-purpose signal processing techniques (e.g., spectral analysis methods, filter designs, linear component analysis methods).    Firm understanding of the inner workings, assumptions, and applicable range of various statistical models, including commonly-used frequentist and Bayesian models, and demonstrated experience applying such models. Comfortable applying statistical validation techniques and criteria.    Solid grounding in common human-subject experiment paradigms and experiment design principles for eliciting neural or behavioral responses.    Excellent problem-solving skills, knack for abstract mathematical thinking (e.g., vector/matrix/tensor data, high-dimensional spaces, probability distributions, etc.).    Excellent English verbal and written communication skills.    High-quality clear writing for contributions to scientific manuscripts, technical reports, technical documentation, and user guides.    Able and willing to fill any knowledge gaps quickly and to learn the necessary theory and tools.     Expertise in one or more of the following areas is a plus:      Applying hierarchical Bayesian models, related estimation/inference techniques (samplers, variational Bayes, etc.) and popular tools (e.g., Stan, PyMC3, etc.).    Adaptive/online statistical signal processing and the underlying principles (e.g., RLS, Kalman filters, etc.).    Sparse signal processing / modeling (e.g., compressive sensing, structured sparsity).    High-performance computing tools and techniques in Python (e.g., jax, cupy, dask).
